#Text=South Ronaldsay
#Text=South
#Text=Ronaldsay
#Text=is the most southerly of the Orkney Islands , with its main settlement being St Margaret 's Hope .
#Text=It 's always been joined by a sandy spit to the island just north , Burray .

#Text=But during the Second World War a series of causeways , the " Churchill Barriers " , was built by Italian POWs to protect Scapa Flow from seaborne attack ; so South Ronaldsay , Burray and the two little islands of Lamb Holm and Glims Holm effectively became part of Orkney Mainland .

column1: #Text=Mostly these islands are just sheep farms .
#Text=But such vital sheep !
#Text=Churchill knew it was illegal to use POW labour for military construction , even if purely defensive .
#Text=So the official line was that the causeways were just to help farmers move their sheep around , nothing military .
#Text=And , since they were only completed by the end of the war , and have only served as peacetime roadways , the great man was vindicated .
#Text=Get in
#Text=A961 is the good road along the causeways to Mainland , which has the main town of Kirkwall , the airport , and the ferry port for Aberdeen and Shetland .
#Text=Bus X1 runs down this road every couple of hours from Stromness and Kirkwall , as far as St Margaret 's Hope ; it does n't reach Burwick .
#Text=Two ferries from the Scottish mainland arrive in South Ronaldsay .
#Text=The car ferry from Gill 's Bay lands at St Margaret 's Hope .
#Text=It 's operated by Pentland Ferries , runs three times every day , and takes an hour .
#Text=St Margaret 's Hope is 30 min by car or bus X1 to Kirkwall .
#Text=The ferry from John O'Groats lands at Burwick on the south tip of the island .
#Text=This service , for foot passengers and cyclists only , is operated by Jogferry .
#Text=It takes only 40 mins and runs May-Sept , three times a day June July & Aug and twice daily in May and Sept ; no winter service .
#Text=A connecting coach runs between Inverness and John O'Groats , then another coach runs on between Burwick and Kirkwall .
#Text=Another car ferry runs between Scrabster and Stromness .
#Text=See " Orkney Islands : Get in " for these and other transport options .
#Text=Get around
#Text=You need your own wheels .
#Text=Cycling is ideal .
#Text=See
#Text=Tomb of the Eagles ( Isbister Chambered Cairn ) , Liddel KW17 2RW ( At south tip of island take B9041 ) .
#Text=Mar 10:00 - 12:00 , Apr-Sep 09:30 - 17:30 , Oct 09:30 - 12:30 ; closed winter .
#Text=Neolithic remains discovered by Farmer Simison on his land , dating to around 3000 BC .
#Text=You approach along a scenic clifftop path , passing a Bronze Age site , " Liddel Burnt Mound " .
#Text=The tomb is entered by a low 3m passage : you crawl in or scoot in on a trolley , into the tall burial chamber .
#Text=Here were found over two dozen human skeletons , and some dozen white-tailed sea-eagles .
#Text=The eagles date to circa 2000 BC : what was their significance in the lives and rites-of-passage of those people ?
#Text=The mystery remains . Adults £7.50 .
#Text=Tomb of the Otters or " Banks Chambered Cairn " lies just south .
#Text=It 's also from circa 3000 BC , and so far is only partially explored .
#Text=It was n't sealed , so over the centuries many otters lived and died within , to mingle with the human remains .
#Text=Open May-Sept 11:00 - 17:00 , adult £6 .
#Text=Do
#Text=Walk Hoxa Head , the headland 3 miles west of St Margaret 's Hope .
#Text=Follow School Road ( B9043 ) west out of the village to Sands of Wright .
#Text=A long walk starts here , up along the quiet lane , or drive / cycle to the lane end for a shorter walk .
#Text=This follows the cliff-top , past the ruins of a WW2 gun battery .
#Text=It used to be possible to short-cut back across the fields , but this path is nowadays closed off .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Best bet is the two hotels in St Margaret 's Hope , see " Sleep " .
#Text=There 's nothing in Burray or Burwick .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Most accommodation on South Ronaldsay is in and around St Margaret 's Hope , where there 's a collection of small B&Bs .
#Text=The Murray Arms Hotel , Back Rd , St Margaret 's Hope KW17 2SP , ☏ +441856831205 .
#Text=3-star handy for Gill 's Bay ferry .
#Text=The Creel , Front Rd , St. Margaret 's Hope KW17 2SL , ☏ +441856831311 .
#Text=B&B and restaurant on sea-front .
#Text=Go next
#Text=It 's either back along the causeway towards Kirkwall and other parts of Orkney , or take the ferry south to the Scottish mainland .
